page.title: 11A COCKFIELD CHILD'S DAY
page.content: My name is Benjamin Shotbolt and I live in Cockfield.On a normal Tuesday I get up at about 6.30 a.m..At 7,I have my breakfast which is"Frosties" and then I get ready for school.The next hour I spend with my train set.At 8.35,I leave for school.There are two ways to get to school and those are by road or by footpath.At school there are two bells to be rung and I ring them.Then we have Assembly,which consists of a talk first,singing next and last of all a prayer.After that we have Maths and then the Rector comes to talk to us. Break is from 10.30 to 10.45.We have a music lesson:this is on the radio and is called "Time & Tune".This term's songs are about Cowboys and Indians.I play a wood block and coconut shells. That lasts until 11.20.Then we have History until lunch,which is at 12 p.m. After lunch in the hall,we play to 1.15
